title: ICE when using a7 register in `asm!` on RISC-V

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
### Code ```Rust // Compile with target riscv64imac-unknown-none-elf #![feature(asm)] #![no_std] #[inline] pub fn sbi_putchar(byte: u8) { unsafe { asm!("ecall", in("a0") byte, in("a7") 1, out("a0") _, options(nomem, nostack)) }; } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.45.0-nightly (215f2d329 2020-05-22) binary: rustc commit-hash: 215f2d3294b08dbdcf8f7d40de21ef1e7eae0a2d commit-date: 2020-05-22 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.45.0-nightly LLVM version: 10.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'already borrowed: BorrowMutError', /rustc/215f2d3294b08dbdcf8f7d40de21ef1e7eae0a2d/src/libcore/cell.rs:877:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.45.0-nightly (215f2d329 2020-05-22) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu ```
Backtrace

This issue has been assigned to @nbdd0121 via [this comment](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/72487#issuecomment-632987272).
